tags.name: ino-carousel
tags.description:
The `ino-carousel` component works in combination with the `ino-carousel-slide` component
and can be used to display an array of images as a slide show. What is more,
it also features an autoplay property that allows the slides to be changed automatically.
Lastly, using the css variables described at the bottom of the page, you can easily customize
the dimensions of the component as well as the duration of the slide transition.

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: Enables the slide animation

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: Enables autoplay which causes slides to be changed automatically

attributes.name: hide-buttons
attributes.description: Hides the arrow buttons

attributes.name: infinite
attributes.description: Restarts playback from the first slide upon reaching the last slide

attributes.name: intermission
attributes.description: Sets the intermission between two slides (Unit: ms)

attributes.name: reverse
attributes.description: Enables reverse playback of the slides

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Optional group value to manually manage the displayed slide

properties.name: animated
properties.description: Enables the slide animation

properties.name: autoplay
properties.description: Enables autoplay which causes slides to be changed automatically

properties.name: hideButtons
properties.description: Hides the arrow buttons

properties.name: infinite
properties.description: Restarts playback from the first slide upon reaching the last slide

properties.name: intermission
properties.description: Sets the intermission between two slides (Unit: ms)

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: Enables reverse playback of the slides

properties.name: value
properties.description: Optional group value to manually manage the displayed slide

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-animation-duration
cssProperties.description: sets the duration of the slide animation

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-height
cssProperties.description: sets the height of the carousel component

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-icon-color
cssProperties.description: sets the color of the navigation buttons

cssProperties.name: --ino-carousel-width
cssProperties.description: sets the width of the carousel component

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Link to the image

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the slide

properties.name: src
properties.description: Link to the image

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the slide

tags.name: ino-chip
tags.description:
The ino-chip component displays the provided content and icon as a chip.

> An ino-chip component must **always** belong to a `ino-chip-set` component.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.

attributes.name: fill
attributes.description: The fill type of this element.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description: Prepends an icon to the chip label.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The label of this chip (**required**).

attributes.name: removable
attributes.description:
Adds a close icon on the right side of this chip.

If applied, emits the `removeChip` event.

attributes.name: selectable
attributes.description: Adds a checkmark if the icon is selected.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Marks this element as selected.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The value of this chip.

**Required** for chips as part of sets of type `filter` or `choice`.

properties.name: colorScheme
properties.description:
The name of the color scheme which is used
to style the background and outline of this component.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: The fill type of this element.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Prepends an icon to the chip label.

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label of this chip (**required**).

properties.name: removable
properties.description:
Adds a close icon on the right side of this chip.

If applied, emits the `removeChip` event.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: Adds a checkmark if the icon is selected.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Marks this element as selected.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The value of this chip.

**Required** for chips as part of sets of type `filter` or `choice`.

events.name: removeChip
events.description:
Event that emits as soon as the user removes this chip.

Listen to this event to hide or destroy this chip.
The event only emits if the property `removable` is true.

slots.name: icon-leading
slots.description: For the icon to be prepended

slots.name: icon-trailing
slots.description: For the icon to be appended - disables the `removable` property

tags.name: ino-chip-set
tags.description:
The ino-chip-set is a wrapper component for `ino-chip` components. It enables the user to filter content,
select a choice, or trigger an action.

> See the `ino-chip` documentation for more details about a single instance of a chip.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
The type of this chip set that indicates its behavior.

`choice`: Single selection from a set of options
`filter`: Multiple selection from a set of options
`input`: Enable user input by converting text into chips

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of this chip set that indicates its behavior.

`choice`: Single selection from a set of options
`filter`: Multiple selection from a set of options
`input`: Enable user input by converting text into chips

events.name: updateChipSet
events.description:
Event that emits when the value of this element changes.

Only applicable if `inoType` is `choice` or `filter`.

tags.name: ino-control-item
tags.description:
A list item component that displays a single instance of choice in a list or menu with a control element (radio-button or checkbox). It functions as a wrapper around the material [list item](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/blob/master/packages/mdc-list/) capabilities.

This component is used as child of `ino-list` and `ino-menu` components.

attributes.description:
Styles the row in an activated style.

In contrast to `selected`, use this for only one item
and to mark it as permanently activated.

attributes.name: disabled

attributes.name: indeterminate

Requires `two-lines` on the parent `ino-list` element.

In contrast to `activated`, use this option to select one
or multiple items that are likely to change soon.

attributes.name: trailing
attributes.description: Places the checkbox at the end of the item

tags.name: ino-datepicker
tags.description: A datepicker is a ui component to select dates and times. It behaves like a native `input` but uses the [flatpickr](https://github.com/flatpickr/flatpickr) library for a better ui experience.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Autofocuses this element.

attributes.name: date-format
attributes.description:
A string to change the date format.
Possible values are listed [here](https://flatpickr.js.org/formatting/).
The default value is `d-m-Y` which accepts values like `01-01-2019`.

attributes.name: default-date
attributes.description:
A string/array containing the initial date of the datepicker overlay. If you're using `inoRange = true` provide an array.
If a `value` is given, this will be ignored.

attributes.name: default-hour
attributes.description:
A number containing the initial hour in the date-time picker overlay.
If a `value` is given, this will be ignored.

attributes.name: default-minute
attributes.description:
A number containing the initial minute in the date-time picker overlay.
If a `value` is given, this will be ignored.

attributes.description: Disables this element.

attributes.name: helper
attributes.description: The helper text.

attributes.name: helper-persistent
attributes.description: Displays the helper permanently.

attributes.name: helper-validation
attributes.description: Styles the helper text as a validation message.

attributes.name: hour-step
attributes.description:
Adjusts the step for the hour input (incl. scrolling)
Default is 1

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Defines the label for this element.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: The maximum date that a user can pick to (inclusive).

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: The minimum date that a user can start picking from (inclusive).

attributes.name: minute-step
attributes.description:
Adjusts the step for the minute input (incl. scrolling)
Default is 5

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The input name of this element.

attributes.name: outline
attributes.description: Styles the datepicker as outlined element.

attributes.name: range
attributes.description:
If true, enables the user to choose two dates as an interval.
Only works with `type="date"`

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Marks this element as required.

attributes.name: show-label-hint
attributes.description:
If true, an *optional* message is displayed if not required,
otherwise a * marker is displayed if required

attributes.name: twelve-hour-time
attributes.description: If true, displays time picker in 12 hour mode with AM/PM selection.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Selects the correct picker corresponding to the given type.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description:
The currently selected date shown in the input field **unmanaged**. The given value
will not be formatted as date.

tags.name: ino-fab
tags.description:
A floating action button represents the primary action in an application. [Floating Action Button](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web/tree/master/packages/mdc-fab) component.
It appears in front of all screen content, typically as a circular shape with an icon in its center.

FABs come in three types: regular, mini, and extended.

The placement of the tooltip which will be displayed when the button is not extended.
Use `none`, if you don't want a tooltip to be displayed.

Use `none`, if you don't want a tooltip to be displayed.

tags.name: ino-fab-set

The ino-fab-set component serves as a container for multiple fab buttons. It contains actions related to the main fab
button. Upon interacting with the fab button, a FAB-Set can display three to six related actions in the form of a speed
dial.

The side where the Fab is displayed.
Possible values: `top`, `bottom` (default).

The direction of the speed dial.
Possible values: `top` (default), `bottom`, `right`, `left`.

The side where the Fab is displayed.
Possible values: `right`, `left` (default).

properties.name: openDial
properties.description: Opens the dial (**uncontrolled**)

properties.name: topBottomLocation
properties.description:
The side where the Fab is displayed.
Possible values: `top`, `bottom` (default).

This component is used as child of `ino-list` and `ino-menu` components.

Only applicable if `betweenList` is `false`.

tags.name: ino-option-group
tags.description:
A wrapper component to be used for a group of ino-options. This component adds a non-selectable header before the options.

Beyond that, if you encounter problems using React or Vue in conjunction with the `ino-select`, use this component as a wrapper around your `ino-option`. This way the virtual DOM will know when to update the `ino-select` and its children, which may otherwise not work properly if the options are added dynamically while deeply nested in the `ino-select'. For more information refer to [this issue](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues/2259).

When using react and vue, an issue exists with slots and the virtual DOM. Read more about it [here](https://github.com/ionic-team/stencil/issues/2259).

tags.name: ino-popover
tags.description:
A Popover is a dialog which is bound to a specific element and appears next to it. Under the
hood, [tippy.js](https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/) is used.

The Popover
and [Tooltip](https://elements.inovex.de/dist/latest/storybook/?path=/story/notification-ino-tooltip--default-usage)
components are very similar. However, popovers are complex dialogs consisting of several HTML elements, while tooltips
can only display plain text.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
Sets the color scheme of the popup
Valid options include: 'primary', 'secondary', 'light', 'transparent'

attributes.name: controlled
attributes.description: Used to indicate if the popover should be controlled by itself (`false`) or manually by the `visible` property (`true`)

attributes.name: distance
attributes.description:
Displaces the popover away from, or toward, the anchor element in the direction of its placement.
A positive number displaces it further away, while a negative number lets it overlap the anchor.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
The target id the popover belongs to.
If not given, the popover is attached to the element provided in the named slot (`popover-trigger`)
or the parent component if a slot element does not exist.

attributes.name: interactive
attributes.description: Use this if you want to interact with the popover content (e.g. button clicks)

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The placement of this popover.
Accepted values: `top(-start, -end)`, `right(-start, -end)`,
`bottom(-start, -end)`, `left(-start, -end)`

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.type: "click focus mouseenter" | "click focus" | "click mouseenter focus" | "click mouseenter" | "click" | "focus click mouseenter" | "focus click" | "focus mouseenter click" | "focus mouseenter" | "focus" | "mouseenter click focus" | "mouseenter click" | "mouseenter focus click" | "mouseenter focus" | "mouseenter"
attributes.description:
The trigger to show the tooltip - either click, hover or focus.
Multiple triggers are possible by separating them with a space.

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description:
Programmatically show or hide the popover.
Can only be used in controlled mode (see property `controlled`).
Use the `visibleChanged` to sync the popovers' visibility state with yours.

properties.name: colorScheme
properties.description:
Sets the color scheme of the popup
Valid options include: 'primary', 'secondary', 'light', 'transparent'

properties.name: controlled
properties.description: Used to indicate if the popover should be controlled by itself (`false`) or manually by the `visible` property (`true`)

properties.name: distance
properties.description:
Displaces the popover away from, or toward, the anchor element in the direction of its placement.
A positive number displaces it further away, while a negative number lets it overlap the anchor.

properties.name: for
properties.description:
The target id the popover belongs to.
If not given, the popover is attached to the element provided in the named slot (`popover-trigger`)
or the parent component if a slot element does not exist.

properties.name: interactive
properties.description: Use this if you want to interact with the popover content (e.g. button clicks)

properties.name: placement
properties.description:
The placement of this popover.
Accepted values: `top(-start, -end)`, `right(-start, -end)`,
`bottom(-start, -end)`, `left(-start, -end)`

properties.name: trigger
properties.type: "click focus mouseenter" | "click focus" | "click mouseenter focus" | "click mouseenter" | "click" | "focus click mouseenter" | "focus click" | "focus mouseenter click" | "focus mouseenter" | "focus" | "mouseenter click focus" | "mouseenter click" | "mouseenter focus click" | "mouseenter focus" | "mouseenter"
properties.description:
The trigger to show the tooltip - either click, hover or focus.
Multiple triggers are possible by separating them with a space.

properties.name: visible
properties.description:
Programmatically show or hide the popover.
Can only be used in controlled mode (see property `controlled`).
Use the `visibleChanged` to sync the popovers' visibility state with yours.

events.name: visibleChanged
events.description:
Emits when the popover wants to show (`true`) or hide (`false`) itself.
This is depended on the `trigger` property.
Use this event in controlled-mode (see `controlled`).

e.g.: `trigger = 'click'` - This events emits with `true`
when the user clicks on the target (slot/`for`/parent-element)
and emits with `false` when the target or the outside is clicked.

methods.name: getTippyInstance
methods.description:
Returns the internally used tippy.js instance
For more informations see: https://atomiks.github.io/tippyjs/

tags.name: ino-tooltip
tags.description:
A tooltip component that displays text when users hover over, focus on, or tap an element.

> Note: A tooltip can only display plain text. For more complex dialogs, see the [Popover](https://elements.inovex.de/dist/latest/storybook/?path=/story/notification-ino-popover--default-usage) component.

attributes.name: color-scheme
attributes.description:
Sets the color scheme of the tooltip
Valid options include: 'primary', 'secondary' 'light', 'transparent'

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
The target id the tooltip belongs to.
If not given, the tooltip is attached to the parent component.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The text shown in the tooltip.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description:
The placement of the tooltip.
Accepted values: `top(-start, -end)`, `right(-start, -end)`,
`bottom(-start, -end)`, `left(-start, -end)`

attributes.name: trigger
attributes.type: "click focus mouseenter" | "click focus" | "click mouseenter focus" | "click mouseenter" | "click" | "focus click mouseenter" | "focus click" | "focus mouseenter click" | "focus mouseenter" | "focus" | "mouseenter click focus" | "mouseenter click" | "mouseenter focus click" | "mouseenter focus" | "mouseenter"
attributes.description:
The trigger to show the tooltip - either click, hover or focus.
Multiple triggers possible by separating them with a space.
